DataElement.preferredDefinition: The technique used in the treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation that produces an effect, or intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Intervention or Procedure Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that utilizes a computerized algorithm to directly determine aperture intensities for optimal radiation dose distributions associated with intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT).

Concepts.definition: A procedure that utilizes a computerized algorithm to directly determine aperture intensities for optimal radiation dose distributions associated with intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that utilizes manual determinations of beam angles and aperture exposure time to optimize radiation dose distributions associated with intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT).

Concepts.definition: A procedure that utilizes manual determinations of beam angles and aperture exposure time to optimize radiation dose distributions associated with intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of internal radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into a body cavity such as the chest cavity or the vagina.

Concepts.definition: Radiotherapy in which the radiation source is placed directly within the body cavity being treated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of internal radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into a tumor or body tissue. (Cancer.gov)

Concepts.definition: A type of internal radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into a tumor or body tissue. (Cancer.gov)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy Volume Modulated Arc Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy Volume Modulated Arc Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.
Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy Volume Modulated Arc Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy Volume Modulated Arc Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.
Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intensity-modulated Radiation Therapy with Static Fields
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy that uses a static multileaf collimator.

Concepts.longName: Intensity-modulated Radiation Therapy with Static Fields
Concepts.definition: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy that uses a static multileaf collimator.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy that uses a gantry that is moved around the patient at variable speeds along with a multileaf collimator that simultaneously varies the shape of the beam.

Concepts.definition: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy that uses a gantry that is moved around the patient at variable speeds along with a multileaf collimator that simultaneously varies the shape of the beam.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
